title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
vmassol - (00:12): CalebJamesDeLisl: I guess you know that there are still 6 tests failing on http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/425/testReport/ ?  
vmassol - (00:12): there's still one WCAG test failing too at http://hudson.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/425/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.it/DutchWebGuidelinesValidationTest/Validating\_Dutch\_Web\_Guidelines\_Validity\_for\_\_XWiki\_Registration/?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:12): Yes, I am working on the web standards test right now.  
vmassol - (00:13): ok great  
vmassol - (00:13): dunno if you'll have the time but would be great if they can be fixed before we release tomorrow afternoon  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:13): 3 of the 6 tests look older than my commit.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): The other 3 are failing because selenium is being blocked from clicking submit because it is putting in invalid information.  
vmassol - (00:14): I can help tomorrow morning  
vmassol - (00:14): but right now it's bed time for me!  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (00:14): Good night.  
vmassol - (00:14): have fun and see you tomorrow  
vmassol - (00:15): thanks  
vmassol left at 00:16 (Client Quit  
arkub left at 01:57 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
sdumitriu1 joined #xwiki at 06:34  
sdumitriu left at 06:36 (Nick collision from services.  
sdumitriu1 is now known as sdumitriu ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:49  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 07:55  
vmassol - (08:00): CalebJamesDeLisl: good morning. Re your mail I'm assuming this was caused by one of my changes re reference refactoring. Is that it?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:00): Good morning. Yes, and I think I know how to fix it.  
vmassol - (08:00): oh cool, I was going to debug it :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:01): You said in a comment that DocumentEntityReference is not used in xclasses. Not true.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:02): It points to the document where the class is defined.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:03): addUserToGroup depends on this.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:04): memberObject.setXClassReference(groupClass.getXClassReference());  
vmassol - (08:04): you mean that getXClassReference() is not used in XClass?  
vmassol - (08:05): right, didn't see your last line  
vmassol - (08:05): that said I don't know why it would fail (that line)  
vmassol - (08:06): I don't recall doing anything special for XClass  
sdumitriu - (08:06): vmassol: Did you revert the change on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SurveyXWikiFeatures ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:06): It doesn't, it just returns null.  
vmassol - (08:06): s/XClass/BaseClass/  
vmassol - (08:06): sdumitriu: yes  
vmassol - (08:07): CalebJamesDeLisl: do you know why it's not set?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:07): When you call getXClass in XWikiDocument, the name is set to the document name, the reference is not set.  
vmassol - (08:08): CalebJamesDeLisl: I don't think it was set before was it?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:08): Isn't the reference replacing the name?  
vmassol - (08:08): yes but I've never dropped any call  
vmassol - (08:08): I've jsut replaced get/setName by get/getDcoumentRefernce  
vmassol - (08:08): and   
sdumitriu - (08:09): Going to sleep  
vmassol - (08:09): get/setClassName by get/setXClassRefrence  
sdumitriu - (08:09): vmassol: Sorry, I didn't have time to commit the color themes  
sdumitriu - (08:09): Too much cleanup  
vmassol - (08:09): sdumitriu: ok will make it in 2.3 then  
vmassol - (08:09): have a good night  
sdumitriu - (08:09): Branch today?  
vmassol - (08:09): we could  
vmassol - (08:10): after the release maybe  
vmassol - (08:10): I would also like to have one  
sdumitriu - (08:10): K, bye  
vmassol - (08:10): breakfast time, CalebJamesDeLisl , I'll be back in 20 mn  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:10): XWikiDocument.getXClass() sets the name if the class is new, it doesn't however set the reference. This is why it is null.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:11): Enjoy your breakfast.  
mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:13  
vmassol - (08:17): CalebJamesDeLisl: what needs to be checked is why it was wroking before and not anymore  
vmassol - (08:17): (to be sure we don't introduce a different behavior somewhere)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:18): Well what was working is the livetable for XWikiAllUsers showed all of the users, now it only shows the admin.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:21): It's more correct to say that adding users makes them not show up on the livetable.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:23): Okay, I looked a little more closely, ClassReference replaces className which I don't remember being used for classes.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:23): memberObject.setXClassReference(groupClass.getXClassReference());    So this is clearly wrong.  
vmassol - (08:24): we still need to understand why it was working  
vmassol - (08:24): it may be a question of null  
vmassol - (08:25): since before there could have been a check for null or "" and now since it's resolved as ref it maybe cannot be null anymore  
vmassol - (08:25): that would explain the Main.WebHome  
vmassol - (08:25): if you resolve "" it'll give Main.WebHome when using a default resolver  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:29): Look at what the line used to be (in the email) It looks like it was getting the name of the document where the class was defined.  
vmassol - (08:29): brb (shower time)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:30): I'll keep investigating.  
vmassol - (08:39): CalebJamesDeLisl: IMO memberObject.setXClassReference was set to "" (empty string)  
vmassol - (08:40): do you know the place where it's used and causing the problem?  
vmassol - (08:40): saveXWikiCollection?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:40): It ends up saving the class as Main.WebHome in the database.  
vmassol - (08:41): ok debugging  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:41): memberObject.setClassName(groupClass.getName());  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:41): This gets the name of the document where the class was defined.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:42): memberObject.setXClassReference(groupClass.getXClassReference());  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:42): This gets null.  
vmassol - (08:42): oh I made a mistake then  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:42): I think you wanted memberObject.setXClassReference(groupClass.getDocumentReference());  
vmassol - (08:42): yes  
vmassol - (08:42): looks like it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:43): It's horribly confusing.  
vmassol - (08:45): good catch!  
vmassol - (08:45): and sorry about that  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:45): No pb.  
vmassol - (08:45): are you committing the fix?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:45): No  
vmassol - (08:45): I can do it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:45): It's your code.  
vmassol - (08:46): oh you can change any code  
vmassol - (08:46): in general  
vmassol - (08:46): I can do it here  
vmassol - (08:46): thought you wanted to reap the awards of fixing a bug! :)  
vmassol - (08:46): (that would be normal)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:46): meh  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:47): It may be the only thing I'm good at but I can trace the line of execution pretty well.  
vmassol - (08:47): :)  
vmassol - (08:47): I'm sure you're goog at a lot of things  
vmassol - (08:47): s/goog/good/  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:48): On another note I think I might send a proposal to the list to start working on putting StringListProp in a separate table, The need for the classType column adds an inner join to literally every db query.  
vmassol - (08:48): ok committed  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:49): Great, can't wait to see what the test says.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:49): You must have noticed my hack to make the tests pass with LiveValidation.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:50): I really like that functional testing stuff, I just need to get better at it.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:51): I ran those tests with and without LiveValidation, waitForElement and waitForText work either way.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (08:55): GWT 2.0 WYSIWYG   "Compiling 56 permutations"  What?!  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 09:13  
nuvolari - (09:13): on the topic of GWT, may I ask a question related to cross-domain posting?  
nuvolari - (09:14): (I ask to ask because it's not xwiki related :P)  
vmassol - (09:15): CalebJamesDeLisl: yeah the gwt compilation is looooooooong  
vmassol - (09:16): reconnecting in 1 mn  
vmassol left at 09:16 (Client Quit  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 09:18

arkub joined #xwiki at 09:27

npm left at 09:47 ("Leaving."  
xwiki-bridge left at 09:48 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer)

KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:03  
mflorea - (10:24): CalebJamesDeLisl: GWT permutations come mainly from browser x locale, it generates FF3+en, FF3+fr, etc., IE6+en, IE6+fr, etc. and so on. The idea is to download only the code that is needed. If you want to build the WYSIWYG locally, then I recoment using -Pdev which generates only one permutation (FF3+en, around 50seconds).  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:24): Thanks.  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:25  
vmassol - (10:26): mflorea: that would be a good tip for the Building page IMO  
kibahop left #xwiki at 10:28  
mflorea - (10:28): vmassol: I could add a subsection of http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HBuildingwithMaven to refer to building the WYSIWYG module  
vmassol - (10:31): yep  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:36): Haha, fixed the watchlist test. It wanted to be at the watchlist manager before setting the duration.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:37): BTW: Is there a way to get to the watchlist manager without entering the url?  
vmassol - (10:41): CalebJamesDeLisl: sure  
vmassol - (10:41): move your mouse to your logged user name  
vmassol - (10:41): in the top right location of the screen  
vmassol - (10:41): in the menu that opens, select watchlist  
vmassol - (10:41): or just go to your profile and click on the watchlist tab  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:41): http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/view/XWiki/Admin?category=watchlist   this?  
vmassol - (10:42): I don't know the url  
vmassol - (10:42): you were asking without using a url :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:42): That's what I get when I follow your instruction, but I need this:  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:42): http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/edit/XWiki/WatchListManager  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:43): I hate to alter a test, but it looks like that's what it was supposed to go to.  
vmassol - (10:43): it doesn't exist any more  
vmassol - (10:43): JV forgot to refactor the test to use the new watch list manager  
vmassol - (10:44): new watch list manager = watchlist tab of your profile  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:44): Ok  
vmassol - (10:44): JV= Jean-Vincent  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:44): I don't see a place to set the duration between mail.  
vmassol - (10:44): it's there  
vmassol - (10:44): I've nsee it  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:44): Without going into objects...  
vmassol - (10:45): seen  
vmassol - (10:45): let me start XE  
Enygma` - (10:47): Hi guys... I`m trying to inititalize a component and I need access to an XWiki Document. To do that, I get the context like (XWikiContext) execution.getContext().getProperty("xwikicontext") but when I do context.getWiki() I get only null. What other option do I have to retrieve a document at component initialization time?  
vmassol - (10:47): CalebJamesDeLisl: you go to the watchlist tab  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:47): Yes...  
vmassol - (10:47): CalebJamesDeLisl: and you can see on the left part "Watchlist Prefrences"  
vmassol - (10:47): CalebJamesDeLisl: to change it, click the edit button  
vmassol - (10:48): (and select the watchlist tab again, that's a pain, it should remember where we are)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:48): Which edit button? the one at the top left?  
vmassol - (10:49): note: I don't like this new way of doing it. I think we should have an inplace modify button  
vmassol - (10:49): yes  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:49): Which editor? Object?  
vmassol - (10:49): inline  
tmortagne - (10:49): yes not very easy to guess how to set preferences  
vmassol - (10:49): just click the edit button  
vmassol - (10:49): it'll go to inline automaitcally  
vmassol - (10:50): if Caleb couldn't find it, it's good proof that it's not usable  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:51): I see it now, I can get the test to work with this. also yous there should be a "Watchlist Preferences" link.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:51): s/yous//  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:51): Thanks.  
tmortagne - (10:51): nexus seems dead again  
tmortagne - (10:52): see the number of version in http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/products/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb/2.2-SNAPSHOT/  
vmassol - (10:52): tmortagne: strange, I asked Alex to check the auto restart and he said it's set correctly  
tmortagne - (10:52): well nexus is runing, at least the wensite but it doe snot seems to clean anything  
vmassol - (10:53): it cleans once per week on sunday AFAIR  
tmortagne - (10:53): ok i tough it was more  
tmortagne - (10:54): once a week is not enough i think, we generate a looot of build in one week  
vmassol - (10:54): yes possibly  
vmassol - (10:54): we can change it to more if needed  
vmassol - (10:55): do we have a disk space pb now?  
tmortagne - (10:55): i don't think so but given the number of build we already have i think we will have one before sunday  
xenon75 joined #xwiki at 10:57  
xenon75 is now known as fmancinelli ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)

nuvolari - (10:59): if I may ask :P  
vmassol - (11:00): nuvolari: hmm I started by myself in 1995 I think  
vmassol - (11:00): maybe 1996  
vmassol - (11:00): but I started coding seriously in java for work in 1998  
vmassol - (11:00): was coding in C/C++ before  
vmassol - (11:01): that doesn't make me younger... :)  
nuvolari - (11:02): wow that's a long time   
vmassol - (11:04): nuvolari: and I started coding in 1983...  
vmassol - (11:04): (on the first IBM PC and in basic)  
vmassol - (11:04): :)  
vmassol - (11:05): wow... 27 years of coding... geez I'm old  
vmassol - (11:05): s/27/26/  
vmassol - (11:06): committers: could you start moving the issues you've assigned to yourself out of 2.2M2?  
vmassol - (11:06): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/BrowseVersion.jspa?id=10010&versionId=11367&showOpenIssuesOnly=true  
vmassol - (11:07): and move stuff that won't be done in 2.2 to 2.3M1 or Future  
vmassol - (11:07): creating the 2.3M1 version in jira now  
vmassol - (11:09): version created  
lucaa left #xwiki at 11:16  
tmortagne - (11:25): mflorea: there is two failing WYSIWYG tests on hudson  
mflorea - (11:25): let me se  
tmortagne - (11:25): http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise-tests/com.xpn.xwiki.products$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/430/testReport/  
mflorea - (11:26): thanks, inspecting  
mflorea - (11:30): btw, there is an issue with the edit menu. I discussed it yesterday here with sdumitriu. The edit menu has a big z-index specified (instead of the sub menu that is opened when you click the menu) and thus it is displayed above the glass panel used by the WYSIWYG editor. I think the skin should be fixed, but I can also change the WYSIWYG css if changing the skin is difficult.  
tmortagne - (11:31): vmassol: it looks like nexus removed completely some 2.1-SNAPSHOT artifacts, see http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/com/xpn/xwiki/platform/xwiki-core/  
vmassol - (11:33): otp  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 11:36  
tmortagne - (11:37): vmassol: i just checked nexus and it's "Empty Trash" which is weekly, "Remove XWiki Snapshots" is supposed to be daily (unless you just changed it)  
tmortagne - (11:38): i think i found why 2.1-SNAPSHOT has been removed: "Remove if released" is enabled  
tmortagne - (11:40): i'm disabling it for now  
tmortagne - (11:41): maybe this mean that we should not use 2.1-SNAPSHOT for the branch but 2.1.1-SNAPSHOT before 2.1.1, 2.1.2-SNAPSHOT before 2.1.2, etc.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:41  
lucaa left #xwiki at 11:42  
tmortagne - (11:43): CalebJamesDeLisl: you should not create jira issue for fixing a test, if the test has been broken by another commit use this commit jira issue id in the commit log  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:44): I looked for an issue but I couldn't find one. I suppose I could have tried svn blame.  
tmortagne - (11:44): et worst don't need any jira issue id  
tmortagne - (11:44): et=at  
tmortagne - (11:45): (if you can't find the breaking issue)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:46): Ok.  
tmortagne - (11:46): unless what you fix is a bug in a test framework of course

lucaa - (13:34): good morning sergiu, guys, what's the procedure to get a project in the sandbox  
lucaa - (13:34): ?  
lucaa - (13:34): I just create it and commit it?  
lucaa - (13:34): contrib/sandbox I mean  
vmassol - (13:36): lucaa: yeah I think so  
vmassol - (13:36): you can always send a mail to explain what you're trying  
vmassol - (13:37): doesn't harm  
vmassol - (13:37): s/trying/doing/  
lucaa - (13:37): ok  
lucaa - (13:43): is there any special groupId or smth that sandbox projects should have? (I think I saw a discussion about that at one point but I don't remember)   
fmancinelli left at 13:54 ("Leaving."  
vmassol - (14:02): lucaa: don't know, but the general rule would be to use org.xwiki.contrib.sandbox.<name> I believe  
vmassol - (14:02): what's sure IMO is that org.xwiki.<new module> shouldn't be used while in sandbox  
lucaa - (14:02): yes, annotations currently break that rule...  
vmassol - (14:03): yes but that's ok  
vmassol - (14:03): since we've already agreed (I think) that we want them in the platform  
lucaa - (14:03): I need some help creating a svn branch: I want to make a copy and have it as a svn copy, but then keep only part of the original directory. What should I do to the things I want to ignore?

tmortagne - (15:31): reviewed

lucaa - (16:03): vmassol: if it's not in this milestone then it's not?  
vmassol - (16:04): normally yes  
lucaa - (16:04): anormally?  
vmassol - (16:04): anormally everything's possible  
lucaa - (16:04): :)  
vmassol - (16:04): but I'd rather not  
lucaa - (16:04): well, the vote about separators doesn't seem to be going anywhere  
lucaa - (16:05): you didn't answer it btw  
vmassol - (16:05): yes I don't have a strong opinion but I'll answer later (I'm on a call right now)  
mflorea - (16:13): tmortagne: yes, I imported. I guess they are not reviewed. the \*.defaultValue keys are on the default translation or on the French? I'm sure I deleted them from svn, and the imported fr translation didn't have them.  
tmortagne - (16:19): mflorea: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/XEXWikiCoreResources\_2018960093\_rendering-macro-formula-parameter-fontSize-defaultValue\_fr  
tmortagne - (16:19): it's possible it has been automatically generated from the default file before you fix it  
tmortagne - (16:20): since at first you committed with defaultValue etc.  
tmortagne - (16:20): what's weird is that it's not set as dead translation  
bbc581 left at 16:33 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)  
vmassol - (16:36): tmortagne: is your change on http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4444 an error?  
vmassol - (16:36): you moved it for 2.1.2?  
tmortagne - (16:36): yes  
vmassol - (16:36): why?  
vmassol - (16:37): it should be on 2.2
